header.headertext: AMENDMENTS TO BE MOVED ON REPORT

text.quote: 84ZBA*: Clause 66, page 62, line 31, at end insert—
84ZEA*: Clause 66, page 62, line 32, at end insert—
“( ) This section shall not apply to acts done in relation to copies of artistic works—
text.IndentOne: (a) within four months after the entry into force of this section provided that—
text.IndentTwo: (i) the copies of the work were manufactured in the EEA; or
(ii) the copies of the work were imported into the EEA before the commencement of this section;
text.IndentOne: (b) after four months but within eight months after the entry into force of this section provided that—
text.IndentTwo: (i) the conditions set out in paragraph (a)(i) are fulfilled; and
(ii) there are extraordinary circumstances justifying the acts.
text.IndentOne: This provision is without prejudice to the other exceptions set out in Chapter III of Part I of the Copyright, Designs and Patents Act 1988.”

text.quote: 84ZEB*: After Clause 66, insert the following new Clause—
“Revived copyright: transitional provisions and use as of right subject to reasonable royalty
(1) Part III of the Duration of Copyright and Rights in Performances Regulations 1995 (savings and transitional provisions) are amended as follows.
text.IndentOne: “(e) to works in which copyright has been revived as a result of section 65 of the Enterprise and Regulatory Reform Act 2013.”
text.quote: “(5) This Regulation does not apply to artistic works in which copyright has been revived as a result of section 65 of the Enterprise and Regulatory Reform Act 2013.””
